:thread: Mesh Manager Config Patching Issue
There has been a recurring issue where if the mesh manager configuration is patched, any subsequent changes to the config are not applied because the older patches take precedence. This has led to multiple system failures, deployment rollouts internally and with customers.
For example, during the 24.01 rollouts, VMAgent (a new addition to platform) caused multiple SaaS pipelines to fail across various environments because mesh manager config did not get updated, and the solution was to delete the patched mesh manager config. Recently, NWM had to roll back their production environment after a major upgrade, and it was discovered that their mesh manager config had also been patched.

We need a strategy to prevent similar issues in environments where the mesh manager config might be patched, either intentionally or accidentally.
@Kai are you the correct PoC for mesh manager?
Also, the biggest use case of updating mesh manager config is to bump version number. How should we address that requirement without needing to patch.
@HH @sudeep  we can help with config templating here?

Thanks for bringing up these issues @abhitaker - agreed it's a problem. @Kai is looking into this and will be putting together a doc of the current limitations with mesh manager config changes evaluating some options to make this better. If it comes down needing to config templating mesh manager config map similar to what we did with nginx etc then we'll let you know
